messages.content:
Dear Jack,

Can you take a moment to imagine what the UK would be like if the Tories had governed on their own since 2010?
But they haven't, and that's because the Lib Dems took the difficult decision to enter coalition.
If the Lib Dems are in coalition with Labour after the General Election this year, we'll work with them to build both a stronger economy and a fairer society.
We’d block any of Labour’s moves to privatise hospitals, deregulate the banks, or close local post offices – like they did during their last period in Government.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Taking the lowest paid workers out of paying income tax.
Giving more money to schools and pupils in disadvantaged areas.
Launching a £35 million campaign to end FGM within a generation.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Whether we are making the Tories fairer, or making Labour stronger on the economy – the Government will be better off with Liberal Democrats in it. Please bear that in mind on polling day!

issues.education: Giving more money to schools and pupils in disadvantaged areas.
issues.health: Launching a £35 million campaign to end FGM within a generation.

contactInformation.address: Freepost RSAA-ZYEA-KLCJ, 62 High Street, London N8 7NX

quotes.text: Schools being run for profit. £10 billion axed from the welfare budget. The Human Rights Act repealed. The snoopers' charter introduced. All of these things and worse would have happened.

leaflet.additionalNotes: P.S. Whether we are making the Tories fairer, or making Labour stronger on the economy – the Government will be better off with Liberal Democrats in it. Please bear that in mind on polling day!
